item.text: (24:2) When Saul returned from pursuing the Philistines, he was told, “Look, David is in the desert of En Gedi.”

He came to the sheepfolds by the road, where there was a cave. Saul went into it to relieve himself.

Now David and his men were sitting in the recesses of the cave.

David’s men said to him, “This is the day about which the Lord said to you, ‘I will give your enemy into your hand, and you can do to him whatever seems appropriate to you.’” So David got up and quietly cut off an edge of Saul’s robe.

<st data-num="01961 0310 03651">Afterward</st> <st data-num="01732" class="">David’s</st> <st data-num="03820" class="">conscience</st> <st data-num="05221" class="">bothered</st> him<n id="1" /> <st data-num="05921 0834">because</st> he had <st data-num="03772" class="">cut off</st> an <st data-num="03671" class="">edge of</st> <st data-num="0834 07586">Saul’s</st> <st data-num="03671" class="">robe</st>.
He said to his men, “May the Lord keep me far away from doing such a thing to my lord, who is the Lord’s chosen one, by extending my hand against him. After all, he is the Lord’s chosen one.”
David restrained his men with these words and did not allow them to rise up against Saul. Then Saul left the cave and started down the road.
Afterward David got up and went out of the cave. He called out to Saul, “My lord, O king!” When Saul looked behind him, David kneeled down and bowed with his face to the ground.

<st data-num="01732" class="">David</st> <st data-num="0559" class="">said</st> to <st data-num="07586" class="">Saul</st>, “<st data-num="04100" class="">Why</st> do you <st data-num="08085" class="">pay attention</st> <st data-num="01697" class="">when</st> <st data-num="0120" class="">men</st> <st data-num="0559" class="">say</st>, ‘<st data-num="02009 01732">David</st> is <st data-num="01245" class="">seeking</st> to do you <st data-num="07451" class="">harm</st>’?

Today your own eyes see how the Lord delivered you—this very day—into my hands in the cave. Some told me to kill you, but I had pity on you and said, ‘I will not extend my hand against my lord, for he is the Lord’s chosen one.’

<st data-num="07200" class="">Look</st>, my <st data-num="01" class="">father</st>, <st data-num="01571">and</st> <st data-num="07200" class="">see</st> the <st data-num="03671" class="">edge</st> of your <st data-num="04598" class="">robe</st> in my <st data-num="03027" class="">hand</st>! <st data-num="03588" class="">When</st> I <st data-num="03772" class="">cut off</st> the <st data-num="03671" class="">edge</st> of your <st data-num="04598" class="">robe</st>, I <st data-num="03808" class="">didn’t</st> <st data-num="02026" class="">kill</st> you. Even though I have <st data-num="03808" class="">not</st> <st data-num="02398" class="">sinned</st> against you, <st data-num="0859" class="">you</st> are <st data-num="06658" class="">waiting in ambush</st> to <st data-num="03947" class="">take</st> my <st data-num="05315" class="">life</st>.
May the Lord judge between the two of us, and may the Lord vindicate me over you, but my hand will not be against you.

May the Lord be our judge and arbiter. May he see and arbitrate my case and deliver me from your hands.”
When David finished speaking these words to Saul, Saul said, “Is that your voice, my son David?” Then Saul wept loudly.

He <st data-num="0559" class="">said</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> <st data-num="01732" class="">David</st>, “<st data-num="0859" class="">You</st> are more <st data-num="06662" class="">innocent</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="04480" class="">than</st> I, <st data-num="03588" class="">for</st> <st data-num="0859" class="">you</st> have <st data-num="01580" class="">treated</st> me <st data-num="02896" class="">well</st>, even though <st data-num="0589" class="">I</st> have <st data-num="01580" class="">tried</st> to <st data-num="07451" class="">harm</st> you.
You have explained today how you have treated me well. The Lord delivered me into your hand, but you did not kill me.
Now if a man finds his enemy, does he send him on his way in good shape? May the Lord repay you with good this day for what you have done to me.

<st data-num="06258" class="">Now</st> <st data-num="02009" class="">look</st>, I <st data-num="03045" class="">realize</st> <st data-num="03588" class="">that</st> you will <st data-num="04427" class="">in fact</st> <st data-num="04427" class="">be king</st> and that the <st data-num="04467" class="">kingdom</st> of <st data-num="03478" class="">Israel</st> will <st data-num="06965" class="">be established</st> in your <st data-num="03027" class="">hands</st>.
So now swear to me in the Lord’s name that you will not kill my descendants after me or destroy my name from the house of my father.”
David promised Saul this on oath. Then Saul went to his house, and David and his men went up to the stronghold.
